Record Class Prompt

java.lang.Object
java.lang.Record
io.github.lambdaphoenix.simpleterminal.prompt.Prompt
Record Components:
cb - the console builder used for styled output
public record Prompt(ConsoleBuilder cb) extends Record
Provides interactive console prompts for user input.

The Prompt class supports various input types including strings, integers, yes/no confirmations, pattern matching, and selectable choices. It uses a ConsoleBuilder for styled output and supports validation and error messaging. All input is read from System.in.

Usage Example:

Prompt prompt = new Prompt(new ConsoleBuilder());
int age = prompt.askInt("Enter your age:");
Since:
0.1.0

    • ask

      public String ask(String question) throws IOException
      Asks the user a plain text question and returns the input.
      Parameters:
      question - the question to display
      Returns:
      the user's input as a string
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • ask

      public String ask(String question, Predicate<String> validator, String errorMessage) throws IOException
      Asks the user a question and validates the input using a predicate. Repeats until the input passes validation.
      Parameters:
      question - the question to display
      validator - the predicate to validate input
      errorMessage - the message to display on invalid input
      Returns:
      the validated input
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      NullPointerException - if validator is null
      See Also:
      • ask(String)

    • askInt

      public int askInt(String question) throws IOException
      Asks the user for an integer input. Repeats until a valid integer is entered.
      Parameters:
      question - the question to display
      Returns:
      the parsed integer
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs

    • askYesNo

      public boolean askYesNo(String question) throws IOException
      Asks the user a yes/no question. Accepts y, yes, n, no (case-insensitive).
      Parameters:
      question - the question to display
      Returns:
      true for yes, false for no
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      See Also:

    • askChoice

      public <T> T askChoice(String question, List<Choice<T>> choices) throws IOException
      Asks the user to select from a list of choices. Displays numbered options and returns the associated value.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of value returned
      Parameters:
      question - the question to display
      choices - the list of selectable choices
      Returns:
      the value of the selected choice
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      ValidationException - if the choices list is null or empty
      See Also:
      • ask(String)

    • askPattern

      public String askPattern(String question, String regex, String errorMessage) throws IOException
      Asks the user for input matching a regular expression. Repeats until the input matches the pattern.
      Parameters:
      question - the question to display
      regex - the regular expression to match
      errorMessage - the message to display on mismatch
      Returns:
      the validated input
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      NullPointerException - if regex is null
      See Also:
      • ask(String)

    • askMapped

      public <T> T askMapped(String question, Function<String,T> mapper, String errorMessage) throws IOException
      Asks the user for input and maps it to a value using a function. Repeats until the mapping succeeds.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of value returned
      Parameters:
      question - the question to display
      mapper - the function to convert input
      errorMessage - the message to display on failure
      Returns:
      the mapped value
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs
      NullPointerException - if mapper is null
      See Also:
      • ask(String)
